text: Aechmea pineliana is a flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is typical of Atlantic Forest vegetation in Brazil, specially in following states: Espírito Santo, Minas Gerais, and Rio de Janeiro. This plant is cited in Flora Brasiliensis by Carl Friedrich Philipp von Martius, and it is often used as an ornamental plant. ==References== ==External links== * Flora Brasiliensis Aechmea pineliana pineliana Category:Flora of Brazil Category:Plants described in 1858 Category:Taxa named by Adolphe-Théodore Brongniart Category:Taxa named by Jules Émile Planchon Category:Taxa named by John Gilbert Baker
title: Aechmea pineliana
